body.p: Clearly state the problem that your PIP is trying to solve. State the current implementation ( if any ) and how it is problemative. Attempt to present how your PIP solves the problem. PIP's that do not solve problems are generally much more difficult to pass.

Place the specification for your PIP here. The specification should explain what your PIP does, what if affects, how it is arranged...etc. Most of the details of many PIPs go in this section. In short, How Does Your PIP Work?

This section is for concerns raised during the discussion of the PIP, both in IRC and via E-mail. When discussing the PIP, what issues came up and how were they solved? This section is a record of the deliberation you had while coming up with and finalizing this PIP.

All PIPs must have this section, if there are no backwards compatability issues then say that there are none. Otherwise please address issues that your PIP may have with older versions of portage, trees, and any database-like items that may be broken or modified by your PIP.
Usually one links to patches to implement the PIP. This section is definately encouraged for all PIPs but is not required at present.
Most PIPs are either Public Domain or the CC-BY-SA license
